result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul E. Cranfield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: The defendant has completed the required hours of Community Service.
11-1-16: Reinstated in Community Service. Hour must be completed no later than December 2, 2016.
Dated 10-27-16 from Community Service Coordinator to Court regarding Defendant's request to be reinstated in Community Service.

Granting Reinstatement in Community Service Program
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED the defendant shall be reinstated to the Community Service Program. The defendant must complete 17.5 hours of community service no later than December 2, 2016.
/s/ 11-1-16
Dated 10-24-16 from Defendant to Court requesting to be reinstated in Community Service Program.
10-20-16: Terminated from Community Service. Credit has been given for the completio of 14.5 hours. Must serve remaining hours as alternate sentence.

Participation in the Eau Claire County Community Service program was terminated for failing to comply with the program requirements. Credit has been given for the completion of 14.5 hours. Must serve remaining hours as alternate sentence.

Defendant appeared without counsel
State by Ellen Anderson, ADA
Defendant advised of constitutional rights, waives right to attorney

Conditions:
No contact with J.M. except incidental contact coming/going from apartment.
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns or bars.
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.

Defendant appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Patrick Waters who informs court that defendant is not eligible for Public Defender.
State by: Kelly Mandelstein, ADA.
